Package com.nickbenn.onehundred.model

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nickbenn.onehundred.model.Game
  • public class Game
extends Object
    Encapsulates the configuration and current state of a single game of One Hundred.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  Game.Operation
      Encapsulates the possible "directions" of play—that is, the arithmetic operation performed in all moves of a game using a given Operation enumerated value.
      static class  Game.State
      Encapsulates the possible states of a single Game, as well as validation of all state-changing operations.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int DEFAULT_MAX_MOVE
      Default maximum amount allowed to be added or subtracted in each move.
      static Game.Operation DEFAULT_OPERATION
      Default game operation (direction).
      static int DEFAULT_UPPER_BOUND
      Default target value (for addition game) or starting value (for subtraction game).

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      Game​(Game.Operation operation, int upperBound, int maxMove, Game.State initialState)
      Initializes this instance with the specified configuration parameters.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      int getCurrentCount()
      Returns the current total—that is, the initial value, with the sum of all moves made in the game so far added or subtracted, according to getOperation().
      int getMaxMove()
      Returns the maximum quantity that may be added or subtracted, as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
      Game.Operation getOperation()
      Returns Game.Operation.ADDITION or Game.Operation.SUBTRACTION, as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
      int getRemaining()
      Returns the non-negative difference between the current and target values.
      Game.State getState()
      Returns the current Game.State, indicating either the next player to move (for an in-progress game) or the winner player (for a completed game).
      int getTarget()
      Returns the target value (for an addition game) or starting value (for a subtraction game), as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
      int getUpperBound()
      Returns the upper bound—that is, the target value (for addition) or initial value (for subtraction), as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
      boolean isFirstMove()
      Returns a flag indicating whether the next move made will be the first so far in the game.
      void play​(int move)
      Updates the state of this instance by applying the specified move.

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Game

        public Game​(Game.Operation operation,
            int upperBound,
            int maxMove,
            Game.State initialState)
     throws IllegalConfigurationException
        Initializes this instance with the specified configuration parameters. Once initialized, the configuration of the game does not change.
        Parameters:
        operation - Direction of game (addition or subtraction), specified as one of the enumerated values of Game.Operation.
        upperBound - Target value (for addition game) or starting value (for subtraction game).
        maxMove - Maximum quantity allowed to be added or subtracted in each move.
        initialState - Player to make the first move, specified as Game.State.PLAYER_ONE_MOVE or Game.State.PLAYER_TWO_MOVE.
        Throws:
        IllegalConfigurationException - If upperBound or maxMove is non-positive, (maxMove >= upperBound), or if initialState is neither Game.State.PLAYER_ONE_MOVE nor Game.State.PLAYER_TWO_MOVE.

    • Method Detail

      • play

        public void play​(int move)
          throws GameFinishedException,
                 IllegalMoveException
        Updates the state of this instance by applying the specified move.
        Parameters:
        move - Quantity to be added (for an addition game) or subtracted (for a subtraction game).
        Throws:
        GameFinishedException - If the game is already completed, and thus permits no further moves.
        IllegalMoveException - If move is non-positive, exceeds the maximum move allowed, or would result in a total exceeding the target (for an addition game) or less than zero (for a subtraction game).

      • getOperation

        public Game.Operation getOperation()
        Returns Game.Operation.ADDITION or Game.Operation.SUBTRACTION, as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
        Returns:

      • getUpperBound

        public int getUpperBound()
        Returns the upper bound—that is, the target value (for addition) or initial value (for subtraction), as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
        Returns:

      • getMaxMove

        public int getMaxMove()
        Returns the maximum quantity that may be added or subtracted, as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
        Returns:

      • getTarget

        public int getTarget()
        Returns the target value (for an addition game) or starting value (for a subtraction game), as set in Game(Operation, int, int, State).
        Returns:

      • getCurrentCount

        public int getCurrentCount()
        Returns the current total—that is, the initial value, with the sum of all moves made in the game so far added or subtracted, according to getOperation().
        Returns:

      • getState

        public Game.State getState()
        Returns the current Game.State, indicating either the next player to move (for an in-progress game) or the winner player (for a completed game).
        Returns:

      • isFirstMove

        public boolean isFirstMove()
        Returns a flag indicating whether the next move made will be the first so far in the game. Implementations of GamePresentation or subclasses of Strategy may make use of this information, but they are not required to do so.
        Returns:

      • getRemaining

        public int getRemaining()
        Returns the non-negative difference between the current and target values. For an addition game, this will be equal to (getTarget() - getCurrentCount()); for a subtraction game, it is simply getCurrentCount().
        Returns:
